alert.note: Alert for Yell (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 03 at 7:29PM CST until March 05 at 3:46AM CST by NWS Little Rock
info.description: ...Observed flooding changed from Moderate to Major severity and increased in duration for the following rivers in Arkansas... Petit Jean River At Danville affecting Yell County. Fourche Lafave River Near Gravelly affecting Yell County. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Arkansas... Fourche Lafave River Near Houston affecting Perry County. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY SUNDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring. * WHERE...Fourche Lafave River Near Gravelly. * WHEN...Until early Sunday morning. * IMPACTS...At 24.0 feet, Portions of Highway 28 effected. Timber and pasture along West Bank floods. Property and livestock should be moved to higher ground. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:45 PM CST Friday the stage was 26.6 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage late Friday evening and continue falling to 4.4 feet early Wednesday afternoon. - Flood stage is 24.0 feet. && Fld Observed Forecast 6 PM Crest Location Stg Stg Day/Time Sat Sun Mon Crest Time Date Fourche Lafave R Gravelly 24.0 26.6 Fri 6 PM 11.5 7.9 5.5 Falling &&
info.instruction: Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. River forecasts are based on current conditions and rainfall forecasted to occur over the next 24 hours. During periods of flooding...Evening forecasts are reissued with updated rainfall forecasts. Observed and forecasted stage data plots are available on our Advanced Hydrologic Prediction Service web page at... www.weather.gov/lzk Under the Current Conditions section...Select River and Lakes AHPS.
